Congo mine bridge collapse: At least 32 killed after overcrowding - video
description: Tragedy struck southeastern Congo as a bridge at the Kalando copper and cobalt mine collapsed, claiming at least 32 lives. Reports suggest panic ensued after soldiers fired shots, leading to the fatal crush.

title: Esophageal cancer vs GERD: Symptoms, causes, and key differences
description: Heartburn, a common ailment, can sometimes signal Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD). While GERD is manageable, persistent symptoms like difficulty swallowing or unexplained weight loss warrant medical attention, as they could indicate a more serious condition like esophageal cancer. Understanding the subtle differences in symptom patterns is crucial for timely diagnosis and treatment.

A tale of three yatras: Why Rahul, Tejashwi and PK failed - and BJP didn't
description: Three major opposition yatras, including Rahul Gandhi’s Voter Adhikar Yatra, Tejashwi Yadav’s Bihar Adhikar Yatra and Prashant Kishor’s Jan Suraaj Padyatra, drew large crowds but produced no electoral gains. The BJP-led NDA won more than 202 of 243 seats, leaving the INDIA bloc weakened. Rahul’s “vote chori” message failed to resonate, Tejashwi’s tour did not expand his support, and Kishor’s long padyatra ended without a single victory, showing that spectacle cannot replace organisation in Bihar’s caste-driven politics.

description: Panic ensued on the Shridham Express after a bomb threat was received for a general coach. The train was halted for extensive searches by security forces and a dog squad. No explosives were found, and the alert was confirmed as a hoax, allowing the train to continue its journey.

title: ‘Negative to airborne asbestos’, but Australia still shuts 69 schools after sand recall
Netanyahu faces far-right backlash after US-backed statement on Palestinian state
Anoop Soni opens up about the mental impact of hosting Crime Patrol: ‘If I’m dropping my son to school…’
The river that crosses 10 countries and flows through four capital cities
description: The Danube River, flowing through 10 European countries, stands unmatched in its geopolitical reach and historical significance. This vital waterway, Europe's second-longest, has shaped empires, facilitated trade, and continues to be a crucial corridor for commerce and biodiversity, connecting diverse cultures and landscapes from the Black Forest to the Black Sea.

title: Kerala BLO's suicide triggers unrest: Unions call statewide boycott; SIR-related job stress blamed
description: Kerala's electoral roll revision faces a boycott by Booth Level Officers (BLOs) on Monday following the death of one in Kannur, allegedly due to intense work pressure. Trade unions claim unrealistic targets for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) and upcoming local body polls are pushing BLOs to the brink. Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the BLO's death.

title: ‘Eden Gardens pitch not a turner’: Ravichandran Ashwin reacts to India’s 30-run loss to South Africa in Kolkata Test
IND vs PAK: No handshakes! India A ignore Pakistan Shaheens after national anthems
description: During the Asia Cup, the Indian senior team avoided handshakes with Pakistan’s players in all three matches between the sides, including in the final. There was no handshake at the toss or after the games, and the same approach now appears to have carried into the Rising Stars tournament. The gesture, or lack of it, has again drawn attention.

title: Delhi blast probe: NIA arrests suicide bomber's aide; car used as 'IED' was in his name
description: The NIA has arrested an associate of the suicide bomber involved in the November 10 car blast in Delhi. Amir Rashid Ali allegedly facilitated the purchase of the explosive-laden car and conspired with the bomber, identified as Dr. Umer un Nabi, an assistant professor with a Jaish terror module. This arrest is a major breakthrough in uncovering the larger conspiracy.

title: Bihar Congress leader: ‘Owaisi’s communal rhetoric was a factor (in Opp loss) … Jeevika didis tried to influence voters during polling’
Pelicans vs Warriors: Time, where to watch, lineups & injury update
description: The Golden State Warriors face the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday, November 16, with the Pelicans under interim coach James Borrego after Willie Green's dismissal. New Orleans, struggling with a 2-10 record and a four-game losing streak, hosts a Warriors team that has won two straight. Stephen Curry's recent 49-point performance highlights Golden State's strong form.

title: In ‘Perfect Happiness,’ You-jeong Jeong — South Korea’s ‘Queen of Crime’ — turns domestic life into a claustrophobic masterpiece
Temba Bavuma: South Africa’s Iron Man with a giant heart, undefeated and unbroken, leads from the front at Eden Gardens for famous win
Israeli forces open fire on UN peacekeepers in Lebanon, no injuries reported
'Have disowned Tejashwi': Rohini says father stands by her; Lalu family feud gets murky
description: Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Prasad Yadav, claims she is truthful about the family feud following the RJD's election defeat. She stated her parents and sisters cried for her, and she feels forced to disown her brother, Tejashwi Yadav, due to alleged mistreatment by his associates, Sanjay Yadav and Rameez Nemat.

title: Terror module crackdown: Accused doctor’s neighbour sets himself on fire after Kulgam police detain his sons, call him to station
UPSC Essentials | Daily subject-wise quiz : International Relations MCQs on Blue Line, Munduruku Indigenous group and more (Week 136)

Bihar govt formation: JD(U)-BJP equal share in ministries proposed, Chirag may be offered 2 berths
IND vs SA: 'Can't call ourselves top Test side' - Ex-cricketers hit out after defeat
description: Former Indian cricketers expressed strong reactions to the team's 30-run loss against South Africa, highlighting a decline in batting against spin and questioning selections and planning. Experts noted that visiting spinners are improving while India's ability to play spin has diminished, leading to repeated mistakes and concerns about Test strategy.

title: Punjab clears farmhouse policy for eco-sensitive Kandi region
Explained | Latest ‘Gen Z protests’: What was the trigger in Mexico?

Harikrishna knocked out in Round 5 by Jose Martinez, Arjun Erigaisi lone Indian in FIDE World Cup 2025
Utah delegation in India, pitches rare earth collaboration
'Tejashwi unpopular in own family': NDA on Rohini's 'abuse' charges; demands answers
description: NDA leaders are demanding answers from Tejashwi Yadav following accusations of "filthy abuses" from his sister, Rohini Acharya.  BJP leaders question his leadership capabilities given family discord. Tej Pratap Yadav supported Rohini, urging their father Lalu Prasad Yadav to act against those he deems "traitors" who influenced Tejashwi's judgment, escalating family and political tensions.

title: Supreme Court sets aside Bombay HC orders granting bail to man accused in 59 kg cocaine, 198 kg Methamphetamine haul cases
‘Abnormal’: Left leader on Bihar poll result; claims ‘three experiments’ aided NDA
description: CPI(ML)L general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya described the Bihar election results as "abnormal," attributing them to three "experiments." These included a Rs 10,000 transfer to women, a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, and land transfers to a "corporate house." Bhattacharya stated these actions created an uneven political playing field.

title: ‘Against fake Godmen’: Bollywood actor Sonali Kulkarni inaugurates Dr Narendra Dabholkar Lokvidyapeeth
‘Their Bengal-phobia is real’: TMC launches ‘Bangla Birodhi BJP’ campaign after MP minister calls Raja Ram Mohan Roy ‘British agent’
‘Time for change’: Tesla bull calls for Apple shake-up; urges scrapping Siri
description: Prominent investor Ross Gerber is urging Apple to replace CEO Tim Cook and integrate Google's Gemini AI, suggesting a strategic partnership to enhance its AI capabilities. Gerber believes this move is crucial for Apple's future competitiveness.  Meanwhile, reports suggest Tim Cook may retire as early as 2026, with John Ternus being a potential successor.

title: ‘If someone gifted me lab grown diamonds, would I be as excited?’: Neelam Kothari Soni reveals why she prefers real gems

Trump tariff rollback offers relief for Indian farmers
Vote share giants, seat share dwarfs: RJD's stunning Bihar polls paradox - explained
description: Bihar's 2025 election saw the RJD secure the highest vote share but a drastically low seat tally, while the NDA achieved a landslide victory. The RJD's votes were spread thinly, resulting in many second-place finishes, a consequence of India's 'First Past the Post' system. The NDA's strategic alliances and efficient vote conversion led to their dominant win.

'You deserve to lose': Ex-ENG captain's attack on Eden Gardens pitch; hails WTC champs
description: Michael Vaughan slammed the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test defeat to South Africa, calling it 'awful'.  However, Gautam Gambhir defended the conditions, stating they were precisely what the team desired.  Despite the controversy, South Africa secured a victory within three days, highlighting the challenging nature of the surface for both sides.

'Bihar approves gobhi farming': Assam minister's post ignites fury; Shashi Tharoor reacts
description: Assam Minister Ashok Singhal's X post referencing "gobhi farming" after Bihar election results has ignited controversy. Critics believe it alludes to the 1989 Bhagalpur riots' "cauliflower burial case," where victims' bodies were allegedly concealed under cauliflower fields. Social media users condemned the perceived insensitivity, prompting a response from Shashi Tharoor who denounced such massacres.

'Rs 14K cr from World Bank funds used in Bihar polls': Jan Suraaj's big charge; Chirag hits back
description: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party alleged the Bihar government diverted World Bank funds for cash transfers to women voters before elections. Spokesperson Pavan Verma claimed Rs 14,000 crore was used, tilting the electoral field. Union Minister Chirag Paswan dismissed these claims as baseless.

Why your blood sugar is high in the morning: major risk factors, and how to manage it
description: High fasting blood sugar in the morning can be due to the dawn phenomenon, a natural hormone surge, or the less common Somogyi effect, a rebound from low overnight glucose. Experts like Dr. Joseph Tejero emphasize that stress, poor sleep, late meals, and medication timing also contribute, requiring a holistic management approach.

title: Toronto in talks to land Cubs’ $460 million standout as blockbuster trade looms
description: The Toronto Blue Jays are reportedly frontrunners to acquire elite two-way outfielder Kyle Tucker from the Houston Astros. This blockbuster move could significantly boost Toronto's championship aspirations by adding a consistent, game-changing bat to their lineup. The trade would address Houston's payroll constraints while providing them with valuable young talent for the future.

title: Kayla Nicole accused of using AI for apology as fans analyse her statement
description: Kayla Nicole faces renewed online backlash over decade-old offensive tweets. Her subsequent apology has ignited a debate, with accusations of using AI to craft her statement. Critics question the sincerity of her remorse, while others argue the focus should be on her growth and acknowledging past harm, not AI detection.

title: ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ sparks theories: Taylor Swift revisits her Joe Alwyn breakup
description: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
description: WhatsApp now allows users to message without saving numbers. This feature, 'Click to Chat,' lets you initiate conversations via a special link. You can even pre-fill messages. Businesses can use the official 'Chat on WhatsApp' button on their sites for easy customer contact, streamlining communication and decluttering your phone.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
description: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.
